definition: homophonic characters
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The third chapter cleans up the syllabary of Gengkou dialect.
sentences.chinese: 第三章整理出了岳陽縣筻口鎮話的同音字匯。

sentences.english: I can't stand when typing, encounter a homophone in the first place is his name.
sentences.chinese: 我受不了打字時，遇到同音字在首位的是他名字。

sentences.english: "Dao", inversion and arrival, is homophone in Mandarin Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 因爲在普通話裏“倒”和“到”是同音字。

sentences.english: The second part is about the tables of Chinese characters with homophone.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是孝南方言同音字表。

sentences.english: There are so many homophones in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 漢語裏的同音字真是太多了。

sentences.english: This paper studies the phonology of the Pinghua dialect of Hunan Province's Tongdao County and lists the homophones.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹湖南通道平話的音系，並列出同音字匯。

sentences.english: Don't waste my time, tell me what is homonyms?
sentences.chinese: 不要浪費我的時間，告訴我什麼是同音字？

sentences.english: Users wrote homonyms for Mr Liu’s name, or abbreviations in Latin characters.
sentences.chinese: 用戶們寫的是劉先生的同音字，或者拉丁字母縮寫。

sentences.english: The forth part: Guanyang dialect" s phonetic features."
sentences.chinese: 第五部分，灌陽方言的同音字表。

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
character with two or more readings
variant Chinese character
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
unison/homophone
phonetic value of a character
everyday words
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
phonetic writing/pinyin (Chinese romanization)
reading or phonetic value of a character
to use letters/to use words/diction
synonym
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
original form of a Chinese character
